newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ's Sky TV secures NZ$250 mln for satellite plan.
newsitem.headline: NZ's Sky TV secures NZ$250 mln for satellite plan.

text.p: New Zealand Sky Television said on Thursday it had successfully raised NZ$250 million through a seven-year term loan facility.
"This funding is part of SKY's satellite expansion plan which will begin in April this year and will allow us to transmit our service to all New Zealand homes," Sky said.
Toronto Dominion Australia Ltd and The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Ltd had co-arranged and jointly underwritten the facility on behalf of Sky.
It was the co-arrangers' intention to syndicate part of the facility in due course, Sky said.
Sky said it was currently constructing the satellite uplink system which would be used initially to transmit Sky's sport channel to the non-serviced areas throughout the country.
"By April next year all New Zealanders will be able to access an expanded multi-channel service," Sky said.
New Zealand's Sky Television is a pay-tv operator and is not related to the European-based satellite network BSkyB.
